sentences.en: In practice it would be possible to measure radioactivity one thousand fold less than this.
sentences.cn: 在实际上,可能测定的放射性比这个值小一千倍.

sentences.en: Natural radioactivity contains a store of valuable information.
sentences.cn: 天然放射性包含着许多有价值的信息.
覆盖层屏蔽掉了放射性.

sentences.en: Radioactivity is a special quality of radium.
sentences.cn: 放射性是镭的一种特性.

sentences.en: Radioactivity is found on both sides of the failure plane in all cases.
sentences.cn: 破断面的任何一侧都发现有放射性.

sentences.en: Radioactivity is the ejection of particles or radiation from the nucleus.
sentences.cn: 放射性是原子从核中射出粒子或辐射的现象.
某些稀有金属具有放射性.

sentences.en: The atomic bomb is characterized by the grave injuries caused by radioactivity.
sentences.cn: 原子弹具有由辐射引起严重损伤的特点.

sentences.en: The level of radioactivity in the soil was found to be above recommended limits.
sentences.cn: 土壤的辐射水平被发现超过规定的限度.

sentences.en: the process of decontaminating areas exposed to radioactivity
sentences.cn: 清除受放射污染地区有害物质的过程

sentences.en: The site was found to be contaminated by radioactivity.
sentences.cn: 发现此地受放射线污染.

sentences.en: The soil contains 30 times the acceptable level of radioactivity.
sentences.cn: 这片土壤受到了高于标准30倍的辐射.

sentences.en: There was in nature another element which sent out radioactivity.
sentences.cn: 在自然界里存在着另一种具有放射性的元素.

sentences.en: They had called the rays from it radioactivity; they now decided to call the element radium.
sentences.cn: 他们从放射性特性方面考虑为新元素命名, 于是决定称其为“镭”.

sentences.en: This example illustrates the great sensitivity of the radioactivity method.
sentences.cn: 这个例子说明了放射性方法很灵敏.
